trails.name: Mt. Tammany Summit
trails.summary: A fantastic loop with outstanding views of Mt. Minsi, the Delaware River and the surrounding area.

trails.name: Bear Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A moderate loop with some fun rock scrambling and amazing views toward the city.

trails.name: Breakneck Ridge Bypass
trails.summary: Breakneck Ridge with a bypass that makes for a shorter hike.

trails.name: Gertrude's Nose Loop
trails.summary: A moderate loop with some of the most epic views and neat rock formations in the Hudson Valley.

trails.name: The Devil's Path
trails.summary: A hike that can frequently be like a climb, with lots of straight up and down on roots and rocks.

trails.name: Storm King Mountain
trails.summary: Hike to the top of Storm King Mountain and enjoy the great views of Hudson Highland State Park.

trails.name: Breakneck Ridge to Sugarloaf Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A must-do route for New Yorkers, plus some added trails and Sugarloaf Mountain, all accessible by Metro North.
trails.conditionDetails: Icy - Some ice but almost completely avoidable

trails.name: Rock Trail (RT) Loop
trails.summary: The Rock Trail (RT) Loop passes by six of the "Rock" features of the trails in Ward Pound Ridge Rez.

trails.name: Bonticou Crag Route
trails.summary: One of the best hikes in the Gunks combining awesome views with precarious hiking!

trails.name: Pinwheel Vista Out-and-Back
trails.summary: Traverse a boardwalk, a suspension bridge, and a cow pasture to climb to the best view in NJ.

trails.name: Pulpit Rock and The Pinnacle
trails.summary: A hike to two rock outcroppings with impressive viewpoints of Pennsylvania farmland.

trails.name: Glen Onoko Falls
trails.summary: A steep hike that takes you by three waterfalls.

trails.name: Peanut Leap Cascade into Giant Stairs
trails.summary: A great but very steep hike with some gorgeous views and fun rock scrambling.

trails.name: Falls Trail
trails.summary: Hike along 22 beautiful, named waterfalls.

trails.name: Whitely Farm Loop
trails.summary: A moderate singletrack loop trail with many other trails that can connect to extend your adventure.

trails.name: Harriman State Park Loop
trails.summary: This loop will bring you past a number of brooks, and up-and-down a good number of great viewpoints.

trails.name: Appalachian Trail Boardwalk to Warwick Turnpike Shuttle
trails.summary: A route using the Appalachian Trail and featuring a boardwalk & the Stairway to Heaven, leading to Wawayanda State Park.

trails.name: High Mountain Preserve Loop
trails.summary: Climb to top of High Mountain to see NYC skyline in the distance, then return to the gullies and woods of the preserve.

trails.name: Buttermilk Falls, Crater Lake, and Hemlock Pond Loop
trails.summary: The tallest waterfall in NJ followed by a glacial lake and one of the largest remaining hemlock groves in the Northeast.

trails.name: Sky Top Tower via "The Trapps"
trails.summary: Access the "Lemon Squeeze" via the Trapps section of the Shawangunks in the Mohonk Preserve.

trails.name: Diamond Mountain
trails.summary: A gorgeous hike with a hard scramble.

trails.name: Lower Susquehanna Heritage Greenway Trail
trails.summary: This flat, gravel, multi-use trail travels along a lush riverbank on the Susquehanna River.

trails.name: South Stokes Loop
trails.summary: Hike through the south section of Stokes State Forest on several trails with view from the AT at the end.

trails.name: Catskills Black Dome and Blackhead Loop
trails.summary: A loop trail that ascends both Black Dome and Blackhead mountains with some limited trail overlap.

trails.name: Rocky Run - Longwall Loop
trails.summary: This is a quick leisurely loop around a small section of the park.

trails.name: Schunnemunk Highlights
trails.summary: Jam-packed and ever-changing fun in a short 6 miles from the highlights of three great trails in Schunnemunk State Park.

trails.name: Prospect Park Trail Loop
trails.summary: A great hike to explore the Prospect Park trails.

trails.name: Sunfish Pond via Mt. Tammany Fire Road
trails.summary: A steep climb to the top of Kittatinny Ridge then along the Mt. Tammany Fire Road to Sunfish Pond.

trails.name: Dark Woods / Big Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A singletrack through part of Weiser State Forest including the Dark Woods Trail and a segment of the Big Mountain Trail

trails.name: Minnewaska Lake Carriageway
trails.summary: An enjoyable hike around an alpine tarn with magnificent views.

trails.name: Silver Lake and Observation Platform
trails.summary: Perfect example of a coastal plain forest with new views around every corner!

trails.name: Split Rock Loop
trails.summary: A long loop around Split Rock Reservoir using a section of the Four Birds Trail and the Split Rock Trail.

trails.name: Macedonia Ridge Trail
trails.summary: A nice trail that heads up to Cobble Mountain and then loops back around the park.

trails.name: Pine Mountain
trails.summary: An awesome route highlighting the best of what Bennett's Farm has to offer.

trails.name: Anthony's Nose to Bear Mountain Bridge
trails.summary: A nice hike leading up to an awesome view and then continuing down to the bridge below and back.

trails.name: Cold Spring Harbor State Park Out-and-Back
trails.summary: Enjoy a scenic section of the Nassau-Suffolk Trail that traverses the heart of Cold Spring Harbor State Park.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry: Optimal conditions. A bit technical (roots, stones, leaves) at Cold Spring Harbour State Park.

trails.name: Clayton Park Loop
trails.summary: This is the main perimeter loop at Clayton Park.

trails.name: North Point Loop
trails.summary: North Point Loop is in the Storm King State Park with great views of the Hudson Highlands State Park across the Hudson.

trails.name: Friday Mountain
trails.summary: An intense bushwhack through balsam fir trees and over large boulders and cliffs to Friday Mountain.

trails.name: Pyramid Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A quietly beautiful loop trail with rocky footpaths, stream crossings, overlooks, and memorable glacial erratics.

trails.name: Cornish/Brook/Notch/Washburn/Undercliff Loop
trails.summary: Hike past an old stone house ruin and enjoy some spectacular views near the end of the loop.

trails.name: Mason Dixon Trail: Lock 12 Shuttle
trails.summary: A quiet hike with views of the Susquehanna River.

trails.name: Washburn/Nelsonville/Undercliff Loop
trails.summary: A nice but difficult hike with great views of West Point Military Academy, the Hudson River, and Storm King State Park.

trails.name: Zoar Trail
trails.summary: A technical and very hilly loop trail with rocks galore.
trails.conditionDetails: Muddy, Icy, Fallen Trees - Very very slick mud in parts

trails.name: Pleasantville Area Loop
trails.summary: This is a loop that alternately overlooks and hugs the picturesque Little Gunpowder Falls.
trails.conditionDetails: Muddy: Leaves make the trail a little slippery

trails.name: Huckleberry Point
trails.summary: This is an easy and very rewarding hike that leads through the forest to a cliff with scenic views.

trails.name: Westmoreland Sanctuary
trails.summary: This route highlights Westmoreland Sanctuary, a 450+-acre preserve in Mt Kisco and Armonk NY.

trails.name: Hornbecks Creek Trail
trails.summary: One of the best kept secrets in the Delaware Water Gap, this trail will certainly not disappoint!

trails.name: Joseph Plumb Martin Trail
trails.summary: An all paved short loop around the rolling hills of Valley Forge National Historic Park.

trails.name: Tuxedo - Ramapo Torne - Dutch Dr loop
trails.summary: A long hike or 1-night backpack with great views and a series of challenging, rocky hills.

trails.name: Swamp Forest Trail (Lums Pond)
trails.summary: A great multi use trail that offers scenic views around the pond and some good, technical trails.

trails.name: Hunter Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A loop trail that will bring you to the summit of Hunter Mountain and back down.

trails.name: Best of Cliff Park and Raymondskill Falls
trails.summary: A sheer cliff and two great waterfalls highlight this relatively easy hike in the Delaware Water Gap NRA.

trails.name: Stockbridge Mountain
trails.summary: This hike makes it up to Stockbridge Mountain and passes the Stockbridge Shelter.

trails.name: Hawk Mountain Sanctuary Loop
trails.summary: This loop incorporates many of the trails at Hawk Mountain into a wonderful loop hike adventure.

trails.name: Stillman-Bluebird Loop
trails.summary: Hike to old stone ruins and great views.

trails.name: Huyler's Landing History Loop
trails.summary: A loop starting from Alpine picnic area that heads along the Hudson River and top of Palisades past historical sites.

trails.name: Ledges/Overbrook Loop
trails.summary: Enjoy vistas of Mount Greylock, the Taconic Range, and the Catskills on this challenging loop.

trails.name: Balsam Mountain
trails.summary: A great grind rewarded with views of the Catskills.

trails.name: Bearfort Ridge and Surprise Lake
trails.summary: A challenging day hike that highlights an ever-changing terrain in Abram S. Hewitt State Forest.

trails.name: Lemon Squeeze, Bowling Rocks, and Valley of Boulders Loop
trails.summary: A classic Harriman State Park route that showcase a wide variety of scenic terrain.

trails.name: Crater Lake and Hemlock Pond
trails.summary: A lovely hike around the blue waters of Crater Lake and through the ridge-top forest to Hemlock Pond.

trails.name: Norvin Green Highlights
trails.summary: The best of Norvin Green State Forest encapsulates the best of what New Jersey hiking has to offer.

trails.name: Palisades Interstate Park via the George Washington Bridge
trails.summary: The Long Path is accessible from 175th Street in New York City. Hike over the George Washington Bridge and take a right.

trails.name: Pine Meadow Lake Loop
trails.summary: A nice hike along a stream, around a lake, and back with limited trail overlap.

trails.name: Camp Mack Loop
trails.summary: A nice route with several creeks, interesting rock formations, and the Eagle Rock vista.

trails.name: Meyer Preserve Full Perimeter
trails.summary: A nice five-mile loop that can be trimmed to two-four miles as needed.

trails.name: Wenonah Trails 5-miler
trails.summary: A 5-mile singletrack route along the Wenonah Trails in Wenonah, NJ.

trails.name: Easy Escarpment Trail Loop
trails.summary: The quintessential Catskills hike on a trail with a view.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry: A small detour (.5miles) takes you to an amazing lookout over the Kaaterskills waterfall -- just follow the numerous signs.

trails.name: Hogencamp Mountain
trails.summary: This is a very nice loop passing abandoned iron mines and some great views from Hogencamp Mountain.

trails.name: Appalachian - Iris Trail Loop
trails.summary: Make a figure-eight loop past Rutherford Lake and return along the Appalachian Trail.

trails.name: Peanut Leap Cascade
trails.summary: A quick, steep hike that leads to a neat cascade.

trails.name: Arcadia Loop
trails.summary: A quick loop through a scenic area west of The Oxbow river with lots of opportunities to spot wildlife.

trails.name: Kaaterskill High Peak
trails.summary: This route highlights a 7.2 mile trip from the hiker's parking lot to Kaaterskill High Peak.

trails.name: Ramapo Torne
trails.summary: A nice hike to some really nice overlooks. There are a couple of scrambles here and there, but nothing too difficult.

trails.name: Three Lakes Trail - Appalachian Trail Loop
trails.summary: This is a figure-eight loop through a forest with fern-lined trails.

trails.name: Deer Creek Trail to Susquehanna Ridge Trail Loop
trails.summary: Deer Creek Trail to North Susquehanna Ridge Trail to Rock Run Mill and back to the start.

trails.name: Buckabear Pond Loop via Bearfort Waters - Clinton Trail
trails.summary: A beautiful loop accessed by hiking the western shore of Clinton Reservoir.

trails.name: Red Loop
trails.summary: An oasis of forest and meadows through the 55-acre Hildacy Farm Preserve.

trails.name: Stokes State Forest Loop
trails.summary: Beautiful hike through the forest and along streams and lakes.

trails.name: Walnut Hill Desilting Basin
trails.summary: A wooded trail through history among the ponds on the NW side of Valley Forge National Historic Park

trails.name: Point Mountain Reservation - North to South
trails.summary: Head from the north section to the south section through fields, over two hills, and along the Musconetcong River.

trails.name: Fir and Big Indian Mountain
trails.summary: Great trail for bushwhacking in the Catskills, not many views but rewarding and challenging terrain.

trails.name: Rockwood Hall Short Loop

trails.name: Audubon Loop
trails.summary: A gentle loop around Mill Grove Wildlife Preserve and Lower Perkiomen Valley Park.

trails.name: Skippack Creek Full Loop
trails.summary: An easy trail that you can start at multiple places and end whenever you want to turn around.

trails.name: Terrace Pond North - South Loop
trails.summary: A long loop hike around Terrace Pond.

trails.name: Jessup/Highlands/Long Path Trail
trails.summary: This is a beautiful hike along an exposed ridge.

trails.name: Brace Mountain Out-and-Back
trails.summary: A challenging rock scramble, a beautiful waterfall, and one of the best summit views of the Hudson Valley.

trails.name: Lenape Ridge Loop
trails.summary: A beautiful ridge hike overlooking farmlands in the Neversink Valley.

trails.name: Butler Sanctuary
trails.summary: Butler Preserve is 300 acres of forest and crags. Part of greenway connecting 6 parks and preserves.

trails.name: Spruceton Trail Shelter Out-and-Back
trails.summary: Fantastic trail for the family in winterwonderland - take your snowshoes and sledge!

trails.name: Mount Nimham Fire Tower
trails.summary: A quick but challenging (all uphill) overlook hike to a restored fire tower.

trails.name: Rand's View Out and Back
trails.summary: A long and steady climb to Prospect Mountain and the mesmerizing perspective of Rand's View.

trails.name: Bear Mountain
trails.summary: A rigorous climb to highest peak in ConnecticutBear Mountain!

trails.name: Thompson Park Big Loop Trail
trails.summary: This is a big loop combining the Red, Blue, Yellow, and Orange trails.

trails.name: Bramley Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A moderately challenging forest loop getaway.

trails.name: Merestead County Park
trails.summary: Merestead is a Westchester County Park with meadows, woods, a historic mansion, and trail connectors

trails.name: Two Ponds Loop
trails.summary: A great loop around, you guessed it, two ponds!

trails.name: Mashomack Preserve Loop
trails.summary: One of the most secluded, wilderness feeling hikes you can get on Long Island!

trails.name: Andes Rail Trail & Bullet Hole Spur
trails.summary: The Andes Rail Trail is an easily accessible hiking trail in an idyllic setting, suitable for individuals and families.

trails.name: Appalachian Trail to Observation Platform
trails.summary: Hike the AT northbound from Rt 23 AT parking area to the High Point Monument wooden observation platform.

trails.name: Oakley Corners Yellow Trails
trails.summary: A nice varied terrain loop, with some small ascents and descents. Keep an eye out for the turns!

trails.name: Bear Creek Preserve Loop
trails.summary: This trail is a lovely short trek that passes several creeks and a waterfall and includes 3 nice rocky overlooks.

trails.name: Heublein Tower from Reservoir 6
trails.summary: Alternate trail to Heublein Tower, avoiding busy trails.

trails.name: Will Warren's Den and Lookout
trails.summary: A short hike on Trap Rock Ridge.

trails.name: Castle Craig
trails.summary: While not the most secluded hike in the area, this short out and back leads to a unique destination with memorable views.

trails.name: Godfrey Pond Loop
trails.summary: A short loop to visit Godfrey Pond, explore the remains of a sawmill site, and enjoy the woods of Devil's Den.

trails.name: West Rock Ridge Loop

trails.name: Cliff Park Loop
trails.summary: A scenic tour of the Cliff Park area trails highlighted by Hackers Falls and Minisink Overlook.

trails.name: Rattlesnake Swamp - AT Loop
trails.summary: Although you probably won't see any rattlesnakes, you'll enjoy this scenic hike through the woods.

trails.name: Harriman / Bear Mountain State Park Loop
trails.summary: A loop with a good amount of elevation change and lookouts that also joins the Appalachian Trail for a bit.

trails.name: Schunnemunk Mountain State Park
trails.summary: A nice mountain loop accessible by bus from NYC that goes through a meadow, up a mountain, and along a creek.

trails.name: Turkey Hill Trail/Low-Grade Hi-Lo Loop
trails.summary: A hillside loop on the Turkey Hill Trail with a return on the rail-trail along the scenic Susquehanna River.

trails.name: Hemlock Hills
trails.summary: Flora and fauna abound on this short hike, giving it a backcountry feel.

trails.name: Sterling Forest Fire Tower Loop
trails.summary: A loop trail through Sterling Forest State Park with a fire tower lookout.

trails.name: West Approach of Slide Mountain

trails.name: Zofnass Preserve Perimeter
trails.summary: The Zofnass Preserve is a six-mile perimeter route with 3 main sections connected by a center "hub."

trails.name: Wiccopee-Fahnestock Loop
trails.summary: A remote loop hike through old-growth forest and with little to no other hikers.

trails.name: Peace Valley Nature Loops
trails.summary: An extensive conglomeration of nature trails along Neshaminy and Hardlaken creeks.

trails.name: Orchard/Hamilton/Pioneer Loop
trails.summary: A loop on wooded trails with the added bonus of a glimpse into the park's rich pastoral past.

trails.name: French Creek State Park Loop with Horseshoe Trail
trails.summary: The forests of French Creek are a nicely wooded destination in Southeast Pennsylvania to find great singletrack trails.

trails.name: Bear Mountain Loop
trails.summary: A loop in Bear Mountain State Park that is accessible by bus from NYC.

trails.name: Steamboat Landing and Crabbing Bridge Loop

trails.name: Stony Lake to Sunrise Mountain

trails.name: Dyckman Hill/Carpenter's Grove Loop
trails.summary: An easy hike in a populated area with views of the Hudson River and George Washington Bridge.

trails.name: Mount Beacon South Summit

trails.name: Historic Smithville Park and Smith Woods
trails.summary: Mix of singletrack, doubletrack, paved road, and open meadows.

trails.name: Hawks Watch via Wildcat Ridge Trail
trails.summary: This hike follows sections of an abandoned rail bed and climbs to Hawks Watch viewpoint and returns via Beaver Pond Trail

trails.name: The Highlands Trail - NJ Section

trails.name: Pyramid Mountain-Kakeout Reservoir Loop
trails.summary: A scenic loop hike through Pyramid Mountain and around Kakeout Reservoir.

trails.name: Mount Minsi Loop

trails.name: Mahlon Dickerson Highlights
trails.summary: An enjoyable woodland route through the highest point in Morris County in an underrated trail system.

trails.name: Ice Caves
trails.summary: This hike takes you up a mountain with beautiful views and a network of caves one cannot miss.

trails.name: Mt Defiance
trails.summary: A short and challenging hike to the Mt Defiance summit.

trails.name: Point Mountain Loop
trails.summary: This is a challenging hike with boulders to climb up to the valley view.

trails.name: Hoffman Park Loop
trails.summary: Hike through old farm area on gravel and paved roads past several ponds, through forests and fields.

trails.name: High Point State Park Highlights
trails.summary: Enjoy a section of the AT, a rare Atlantic Cedar Swamp, and breathtaking views from the highest point in NJ.

trails.name: Griggstown Grasslands
trails.summary: A nice walk in mostly open fields with one wooded section.

trails.name: Rockleigh Woods/Lamont Reserve
trails.summary: Easy hike for family and pets, about 30 feet from New York City.

trails.name: Ridley Creek SP: Yellow-White-Yellow Loop
trails.summary: A nice, rolling singletrack loop in southeastern PA.

trails.name: Appalachian Trail - Fox Gap to Columbia Gas Pipeline
trails.summary: A short section of the Appalachian Trail leading from Fox Gap in PA to the Columbia Gas Pipeline.

trails.name: Valley Creek and Knox Farm
trails.summary: A short loop to visit an old/abandoned forge inside Valley Forge National Historical Park.

trails.name: West Deptford Park Cross Country Trails
trails.summary: A nice loop through West Deptford Park.

trails.name: Labyrinth and Lemon Squeeze

trails.name: Breakneck Ridge Trail

trails.name: Orange Trail

trails.name: Gertrude's Nose Trail
trails.summary: A remote trail accessing stunning views of the Hudson Valley and Palmaghatt Ravine.

trails.name: Nassau-Suffolk Trail

trails.name: Giant Ledge-Panther-Fox Hollow Trail

trails.name: Shore Trail (White): The Giant Stairs

trails.summary: A short loop dominated by mature oak woodland and pine plantation through this steeply-sloped preserve.

trails.name: Upper Francis Pond Preserve
trails.summary: Verdant forest surrounds Upper Francis Pond, home to an old tulip tree stand and a nesting site for hummingbirds.

trails.name: Medium Loop
trails.summary: This loop is half uphill and half downhill.

trails.name: Turtleback Loop
trails.summary: Follow the orange blazes to stay on this loop trail.

trails.summary: Needs Summary

trails.name: Hope Goddard Iselin Preserve

trails.name: Nawahunta Fire Road

trails.name: Curtis-Ormsbee Trail
trails.summary: This blue-blazed trail traverses dense hardwood forests between two major trails in the Slide Mountain Wilderness.

trails.name: McDade Recreational Trail
trails.summary: A park-spanning multi-use path that rewards visitors with dramatic landscapes and exceptional views.

trails.name: Split Rock Trail
trails.summary: This trail extends the length of the eastern shore of Split Rock reservoir.

trails.name: Pine Trail
trails.summary: An awesome rolling trail with through the New Jersey pine barrens.

trails.name: Fahnestock Trail
trails.summary: This trail spans the Clarence Fahnestock Memorial State Park from east to west.

trails.name: Dunning Trail
trails.summary: This easy/moderate trail uses parts of old mining roads as it meanders across Harriman State Park.

trails.name: Rittenhouse Trail
trails.summary: A mostly flat, but rooty singletrack trail that connects Fair Hill and White Clay Creek State Park.

trails.name: Three Lakes Trail
trails.summary: This is a nice trail through a forest with very little hiking traffic. Enjoy nice rest spots at two lakes along the way.

trails.name: Garvey Springs Trail
trails.summary: This trail ascends a gap on Mount Mohican to reach the Appalachian Trail.

trails.name: Rowan College at Gloucester County Trail
trails.summary: A singletrack trail with plenty of short steep climbs and lots of roots.

trails.name: Mattabesett Trail
trails.summary: The Mattabesett Trail is a part of the New England National Scenic Trail that winds through central Connecticut.

trails.name: Yellow Trail
trails.summary: A nice loop through Lewis Morris Park

trails.name: Hillburn-Torne Sebago
trails.summary: A scenic north-south trail from Lake Sebago to Ramapo Torne.

trails.name: Turquoise Trail
trails.summary: A trail connecting the Mt. Tammany Fire Road to the the Appalachin Trail just north of Sunfish Pond.

trails.name: East Setauket
trails.summary: A lot of trail packed into a city park.

trails.name: Ringwood-Ramapo Trail
trails.summary: This is a nice ridgeline trail through Ramapo Mountain State Forest.

trails.name: Stony Brook Trail
trails.summary: Trail along the Stony Brook with cascades in the northwest section. Useful trail for making loop hikes.

trails.name: Arden-Surebridge (AS) Trail
trails.summary: This pleasant forest trail traverses rolling terrain and offers great views year-round.

trails.name: Long Path: Section 6
trails.summary: This section of the Long Path heads north-south through Harriman State Park.

trails.name: Allamuchy Pond Trail
trails.summary: This is a fun uphill trail that slowly makes its ascent into the Deer Park Trail System.

trails.name: Huckleberry Point Trail
trails.summary: This trail offers some memorable views of the Hudson Valley, Indian Head, Plattekill, and Twin Mountains.

trails.name: Skyline Trail
trails.summary: The Skyline Trail is rocky and rugged throughout, and you'll need to climb up and down rocks.

trails.name: AT: Blue Mountain Eagle Climbing Club - West (PA)
trails.summary: Needs Adoption

trails.name: Crater Lake Trail
trails.summary: Lush, established forests and a pristine glacier-formed lake make this trail a real treat.

trails.name: Northwest Path
trails.summary: This trail has a fair amount of elevation change given its location, but its still quite mellow and accessible.

trails.name: Pennypack Trail - Montgomery County
trails.summary: A multi-use trail traveling from Huntingdon Valley to the county border.

trails.name: Battery Lewis Trail
trails.summary: A short 0.4 mile paved path past the WWII gun battery.

trails.name: White Trail
trails.summary: A nice rocky and wooded trail that leads around the ski area perimeter.

trails.name: Blackledge Falls Trail
trails.summary: A sweet singletrack down to Blackledge Falls.

trails.name: Basin Pond Trail
trails.summary: State of the art trail design and gentle grades culminate in a nice lake view.

trails.name: Millstone Trail
trails.summary: A trail with a nice overlook of the Middle Creek Valley. The easternmost leg is the steepest and rockiest section.

trails.name: Red Trail
trails.summary: A great technical trail in the first half with a smooth second half.

trails.name: Cross Country Trail
trails.summary: This varied terrain trail feathers meadows, woods, and water with lots of wildlife to be seen.

trails.name: Falling Waters Trail
trails.summary: This is a rocky, forested trail along Electric Brook.

trails.name: Hunter Mountain Trail
trails.summary: A 1.5-mile trail connecting the Devil's Path Trail and the summit of Hunter Mountain.

trails.name: Turtle Trail
trails.summary: Needs adoption!

trails.name: Yellow Trail - Pine Mountain
trails.summary: A beautiful trail gaining the highest point in Bennett's Pond State Park - Pine Mountain.

trails.name: Bearfort Waters - Clinton Trail
trails.summary: A point-to-point trail starting at the southern end on Clinton Reservoir and ending in Wawayanda State Park.

trails.name: B6 Trail
trails.summary: A moderately hilly hike through Oakley Corners Blue Trails.

trails.name: The Silver Trail
trails.summary: This little gem sits right off the famous Clove Lakes Park.

trails.name: Montville-Butler Trail
trails.summary: This trail traverses the western shore of Kakeout Reservoir.

trails.name: Newark Reservoir Path
trails.summary: A paved path around the rim of the Newark Reservoir with great views.

trails.name: Boulder Gorge Trail (Green)
trails.summary: This trail runs along the creek and is steep and difficult.

trails.name: Iris Trail
trails.summary: An easy forest trail that gives access to Rutherford Lake and the Appalachian Trail.

trails.name: Smith Bridge to Ramsay Road
trails.summary: A doubletrack road entering First State Park from the Smith Bridge picnic area.

trails.name: Deer Path Trail
trails.summary: The longest trail in the area, following the perimeter of the park.

trails.name: Vaughn's Trail
trails.summary: The best climb in the area.

trails.name: Rattlesnake Swamp Trail
trails.summary: A quaint trail passing through dense forests, rolling streams, and marshy swamps.

trails.name: Little Gunpowder Trail (Pleasantville Rd to Bottom Rd)
trails.summary: Climb the hill to the rail bed, transitions into multiple challenging climbs and stream crossings.

trails.name: Ernest Walter Trail
trails.summary: The gem of Abram S. Hewitt State Forest, this trail offers incredible views, rock scrambles, and two wonderful lakes.

trails.name: Cliffs of Insanity Trail
trails.summary: A sweet, long descent to the flats on the way to Beechwood Rd. and the Beechwood Climb.

trails.name: Whipping Post
trails.summary: A two-mile singletrack downhill that ends at Buttrick Road Trail.

trails.name: Red Trail
trails.summary: Nice singletrack running through the heart of Six Mile Run.

trails.name: Fossil Trail
trails.summary: A lovely trail through a lush green ravine, providing visitors with access to a rich fossil bed.

trails.name: Kazimiroff Nature Trail
trails.summary: A short, fun trail in NYC.

trails.name: Little Jersey Trail
trails.summary: A nice trail in Lums Pond.

trails.name: Covered Bridge Trail
trails.summary: A new trail from the Meadow up to Fox Hill that incorporates new Eagle Scout covered bridge project.

trails.name: Taj Mahal
trails.summary: A rolling buffed singletrack connecting the power lines and Metacomet Trail.

trails.name: Quarry Hill Trail
trails.summary: A very challenging rock scramble and ascent to Taconic Ridge.

trails.name: Tamarack Trail
trails.summary: The Tamarack Trail in Byram, NJ leads from CO Johnson Park to Route 206 and back.

trails.name: Bearfort Ridge Trail
trails.summary: A tough elevation gain at the onset pays off with minor rock scrambles and fun along a relatively flat ridgeline.

trails.name: Scenic Gorge Trail
trails.summary: A scenic trail through diverse ecosystems and abundant natural features.

trails.name: Lenape Ridge Trail
trails.summary: The trail follows Lenape Ridge overlooking the Neversink Valley.
